name: U.S. Presidential Mixture Quiz | U.S. Government | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who was the only President who was also the Speaker of the House of Representatives?
Which President took a cold foot bath every morning for 60 years?
Who was the first President to serve in the U.S. Navy as either an enlisted member or officer?
Who was the first President to be born in a hospital?
Which President's favorite sport was fox hunting?
Three Whigs have served as President of the United States. Which one of the following Presidents did not serve as a Whig?
questions.explanation:
John Tyler.

	John Tyler did not serve as a Whig. He was a Democrat.

questions.text: Who was the first President whose mother was eligible to vote for him?
Which President was shot on Good Friday?
questions.explanation:
Abraham Lincoln.

	Abraham Lincoln was shot and killed on Good Friday at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.

questions.text: Who was the first President to visit all 50 states?
Which President owned a pet alligator which he kept in the East Room of the White House?
Which of these Presidents did not make an Inaugural Address?
Who was the only President to also serve as Chief Justice in the Supreme Court?
questions.explanation:
William Howard Taft.

	Taft never wanted to be President, he just wanted to be Chief Justice of the Supreme Court. But his wife wanted to be the first lady and she convinced him to run for President and he did so and won.

questions.text: Who is the first left-handed President to serve two terms?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Reagan.

	Ronald Reagan was the first President to be left-handed and serve 2 terms, though early on his life, his teachers forced him to write right-handed.

questions.text: Who was the first President to use the telephone while in office?
questions.explanation:
Rutherford B. Hayes

	Rutherford B. Hayes was the first President to use the telephone while in office. The telephone was installed in the White House in 1879.

questions.text: Which U.S. president's body was exhumed because some thought that his death was caused by murder instead of natural causes?
questions.explanation:
Zachary Taylor.

	Zachary Taylor's body was exhumed because some thought that he was poisoned somehow and that is how he died.

questions.text: Who is the only President to serve in both World Wars?
questions.explanation:
Dwight D. Eisenhower

	Believe it or not, Dwight Eisenhower served in both World War I and World War II.

questions.text: Which President was once engaged to the daughter of a Texas Ku Klux Klan leader?
questions.explanation:
Lyndon B. Johnson

	Yup, Lyndon Johnson was engaged to the daughter of a Ku Klux Klan leader. He broke it off when he heard what her father had said about him. 'I won't have my daughter marrying into that no-account Johnson family. I've known that bunch all my life, one generation after another of shiftless dirt farmers and grubby politicians. Always sticking together and leeching into one another so the minute one starts to make it, the others drag him down. None of them will ever amount to a damn.'

questions.text: Who was the first U.S. Congressman to become President?
Who is the only President who made his own clothes?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Johnson.

	Yes, Andrew Johnson made his own clothes as well as his own cabinets.

questions.text: Who was the first President to ride in an automobile?
Which President smoked ten to twenty cigars a day?
questions.explanation:
Ulysses S. Grant

	Yup, Grant smoked ten to twenty cigars a day and eventually got throat cancer and died.

questions.text: Who was the only President to serve in both the Revolutionary War and the War of 1812?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Jackson.

	Interestingly enough, Jackson served in both wars. He was only 13 when serving in the Revolutionary War and he was held as a prisoner by the British.

questions.text: Who was the first President born after the Declaration of Independence was signed?
Who was the first President to send a trans-Atlantic telegram?
Out of all the Presidents, who had the biggest feet?
questions.explanation:
Warren G. Harding

	Yup, Harding had a size fourteen shoe. Lincoln was the tallest and Taft was the heaviest, but Harding had the biggest feet.
